name: frigidity
content:
frigidity noun [U]
(DISLIKING SEX)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(used especially of women) the condition of not becoming sexually excited or not enjoying sex: Her mother went to see a psychiatrist for frigidity. Fear of another miscarriage had led to her frigidity.
More examplesFewer examplesHis aggressive sexuality did not help to overcome his wife's apparent frigidity. She counseled women widely on menopause, frigidity, and sexual relations in marriage. The psychologist believes sexual frigidity is rooted in childhood trauma.
frigidity noun [U]
(UNFRIENDLINESS)
the fact of being unfriendly or very formal: He is doomed to repeat the frigidity of his father's life. The film's main theme is emotional frigidity.
More examplesFewer examplesMany actresses have a frigidity about them.She pushed people away with her meanness and frigidity.

(COLD)
